Name: New Year's Day
Description: New Year's Day is a festival observed in most of the world on 1 January, the first day of the year in the modern Gregorian calendar.

Name: Makara Sankranti
Description: Makar Sankranti is a Hindu festival that celebrates Sun's transition into Makar

Name: Pongal
Description: Pongal is a harvest festival celebrated by the Tamil community.

Name: Magh Bihu
Description: Magh Bihu is a harvest festival celebrated in Assam, North-East India

Name: Tusu Puja
Description: Tusu Festival is a folk festival held on the last day of the Bengali month of Poush, i.e., Makar Sankranti

Name: Imoinu Iratpa
Description: Imoinu Iratpa is the religious festival of lights dedicated to the Manipuri Goddess Imoinu Ahongbi.

Name: Gann-Ngai
Description: Gaan-Ngai is a festival of the Zeliangrong people of Assam, Manipur and Nagaland.

Name: Republic Day
Description: Day to mark and celebrate the date on which the Constitution of India came into effect

Name: Vasant Panchami
Description: festival that marks the preparation for the arrival of spring.

Name: Maha Shivratri
Description: Maha Shivaratri is a Hindu festival celebrated annually in honour of the god Shiva.

Name: Muhammad's Ascension to Heaven
Description: the ascension of the Prophet Muhammad into heaven

Name: International Women's Day
Description: Day commemorate the cultural, political, and socioeconomic achievements of women.

Name: Holi
Description: Holi is a popular ancient Hindu festival, also known as the Festival of Love, the Festival of Colours

Name: Navratra
Description: Navaratri is a Hindu festival that spans over nine nights and is celebrated every year in the autumn season.

Name: Ram Navami
Description: Rama Navami is a Hindu spring festival that celebrates the birthday of Shree Rama

Name: Vaisakhi
Description: spring harvest festival for many Indians.

Name: Good Friday
Description: Good Friday is a Christian holiday commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus and his death at Calvary.

Name: Labor Day
Description: The day is observed as an occasion to commemorate the contributions of labourers and working class.

Name: Mother's Day
Description: Mother's Day is a celebration honoring the mother of the family or individual, as well as motherhood, maternal bonds, and the influence of mothers in society.

Name: Father's Day
Description: Father's Day is a holiday of honoring fatherhood and paternal bonds, as well as the influence of fathers in society.

Name: Friendship Day
Description: Friendship Day is a day in several countries for celebrating friendship.

Name: Raksha Bandhan
Description: Raksha Bandhan is a Hindu festival celebrating the relationship between brothers and sisters.

Name: Independence Day
Description: The day marks India's freedom from the British rule.

Name: Janmashtami
Description: an annual Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Krishna

Name: Ganesh Chaturthi
Description: Festival celebrating the arrival of Lord Ganesh to earth from Kailash Parvat with his mother Goddess Parvati/Gauri.

Name: Onam
Description: A major annual event for Keralites, it is the official festival of the state and includes a spectrum of cultural events. Drawing from Hindu mythology, Onam commemorates King Mahabali and Vamana.

Name: Durgashtami
Description: one of the most auspicious days of the five days long Durga Puja Festival.

Name: Dussehra
Description: Celebrates the victory of good over evil

Name: Durga Puja
Description: festival originating in the Indian subcontinent which reveres and pays homage to the Hindu goddess Durga

Name: Diwali
Description: Diwali is a festival of lights and one of the major festivals

Name: Kali Puja
Description: Kali Puja is a regional public holiday observed in several Indian states on the new moon in the month of Kartik.

Name: Govardhan Puja
Description: festival in which devotees worship Govardhan Hill and prepare and offer a large variety of vegetarian food to Krishna as a mark of gratitude.

Name: Bhai Duj
Description: Bhai Dooj, the final day of Diwali festivities, is celebrated on the second lunar day of Shukla Paksha in the Hindu calendar month of Kartika.

Name: Christmas Day
Description: Christmas is an annual festival commemorating the birth of Jesus Christ
